title: A girl purchased 20 dozens of toys at the rate of ₹ 375 per dozen. She sold each one of them at the rate of ₹ 396. What was her percentage profit? - Quora

response.answer_text: Cost of one toy is 375/12 = 31.25 sale price ‘each one ‘ = 396 Profit on each = 396 - 31.25 = 364.75 % profit = 364.75/31.25 X 100 = 1167.2 % Catch here is that the sale price of ‘each one’ has been given and not of one dozen.
